qas.question: Who else did the BSA issues a report in 2011 with?
What percentage of people admit to pirating software?
What was the commercial value of pirated software in 2011?
What nation had the higest piracy rate?
What was the U.S.'s piracy rate?
Who else did the BSA issues a report in 2001 with?
What percentage of people admit to pirating hardware?
What was the commercial value of pirated hardware in 2011?
What nation had the lowest nonpiracy rate?
What was the U.N.'s piracy rate?

context: In its 2011 report, conducted in partnership with <a0_0><b5_0>IDC and Ipsos Public Affairs<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the BSA stated: "Over half of the world's personal computer users – <a1_0><b6_0>57 percent<b6_0/><a1_0/> – admit to pirating software." The ninth annual "BSA Global Software Piracy Study" claims that the "commercial value of this shadow market of pirated software" was worth <a2_0><b7_0>US$63.4 billion<b7_0/><a2_0/> in 2011, with the highest commercial value of pirated PC software existent in the U.S. during that time period (US$9,773,000). According to the 2011 study, <a3_0><b8_0>Zimbabwe<b8_0/><a3_0/> was the nation with the highest piracy rate, at 92%, while the lowest piracy rate was present in the U.S., at <a4_0><b9_0>19%<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
